other_tests.findings: Trace bilateral pleural effusions with minimal atelectasis at the right base. No pericardial effusion. Extensive dense coronary artery calcifications. Aortic valve calcifications. Liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys show no acute abnormalities. Bilateral renal hypodensities predominantly too small to characterize. A 3.2-cm round fluid density lesion in the right kidney likely represents a simple cyst. A 5.4-cm fluid density lesion arising from the right kidney likely represents a cyst. Mild wall thickening of the ascending colon with adjacent stranding likely secondary to recent polypectomy. Gallbladder is distended with mild adjacent stranding and fluid. A small hyperdense stone in the gallbladder. The appendix is not visualized, with no secondary signs of acute right lower quadrant inflammation. Markedly enlarged prostate, right-sided fat-containing inguinal hernia, moderate arterial atherosclerotic calcifications, and degenerative changes in the spine.
